meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or derived from tartar
meanings.sent1: The tartaric flavor of the sauce made it unique.
meanings.sent2: The tartaric crystals formed a pattern on the glass.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the tartaric stains on the teeth looked like tiny stars.
meanings.sent4: The tartaric essence of the wine lingered on his palate.
meanings.sent5: The tartaric smell in the air reminded her of baking cookies.

meanings.sent1: The tartaric buildup on the kettle was hard to remove.
meanings.sent2: Her teeth felt rough due to the tartaric deposits.
meanings.sent3: The tartaric residue on the pan made it look ancient.
meanings.sent4: The tartaric texture of the stone resembled coral.
meanings.sent5: The tartaric taste of the water indicated it needed cleaning.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or characteristic of tartar
meanings.sent1: The tartaric nature of the substance made it difficult to dissolve.
meanings.sent2: His tartaric breath hinted at his recent meal.
meanings.sent3: The tartaric quality of the paint gave it a rough finish.
meanings.sent4: The tartaric color of the stone matched the cliffs.
meanings.sent5: The tartaric sound of the kettle boiling filled the kitchen.
